page.title: 03The school day in Thurlow
page.content: The school has a fairly fluid day, starting with assembly which deals with moral rather than religious themes. Group projects are used to teach the younger children with more structured lessons for the older children. Project subjects spill over into the school's social life, so that the American Indian project culminated in a Red Indain barbecue. Grace is said before lunch and outdoor playtime follows. Role playing is not encouraged but boys tend to play football and model cars, and girls skipping and chasing games. The school visits Haverhill swimming pool in winter but has its own swimming pool outdoors for the summer, and an acre of playing field which has a problem with moles. On Wednesday afternoon the children choose from a number of crafts.
